meanings.definition: To put a saddle on (a horse)
meanings.sent1: He saddled the horse before going for a ride.
meanings.sent2: She always saddled her horse before heading out on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The horse giggled when it saw the saddle coming its way.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility saddled him like a heavy saddle on a horse.
meanings.sent5: The image of the horse being saddled stuck in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The heavy workload saddled him with stress.
meanings.sent2: The debt saddled on him was difficult to bear.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a backpack full of rocks would be less saddling than this.
meanings.sent4: The guilt of his actions saddled him like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of the project was a saddling burden on his mind.

meanings.definition: To impose a task or responsibility on
meanings.sent1: She saddled him with the duty of cleaning the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The teacher saddled the students with a challenging assignment.
meanings.sent3: Being the class pet sitter was a saddling task for him.
meanings.sent4: The new role saddled him with unexpected responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The promotion came with a saddling amount of new duties.
